DOC.brief_summary: This study aim is to evaluate the needle positioning precision, compared to the real path planned by the physician on healthy voluntaries, by positioning a fictional needle, without inserting it. Additionally, this study will evaluate: - the robot precision, - the robot detection robustness, - the software and device ergonomics, - the device security.
DOC.brief_title: Light Needle Positioning Robot Under MRI Guidance
DOC.criteria: person over 18 years old, person with height is under 1m90, person with abdomen height is under 28 cm, person with abdomen width is between 26 cm to 50 cm, person able to hold his breath during 30 seconds, person affiliated to social security or similarly regime, signed consent for participation in the study. person with a contraindication for abdomen MRI, claustrophobic person, protected person referred to in Articles L11215 to L11218 of the Code of Public Health
